WRITING.TEXT: Sometimes I think it might be a curse to hold all this knowledge! LMAO!

It's an error; Both an error on CW's part and How it was aired in the first place. Back when Season 3 aired; (Bare with me it's sort of a loaded explanation) We were given Episode 327 (Going by prod. number) The first time aired, it was uncensored and the Drew game was actually Quick Change! And this episode was aired during the 10PM slot rather than the original 8PM slot, (Also being dubbed as "Too Hot For 8PM"); Even odder is that 327 was aired back-to-back with ep 326(Episode prod number 326), and was actually made to seem like one episode (Even 327's credit reading was slashed to make it seem as if it was one episode. Heck originally, 326, the episode that followed, had Brad Sherwood listed in the credits!). That was the first airing of that episode anyhow.
The story for episode 334 (What I believe is listed as ep 322 on CwSeed??) was with its original airing, Props was the Drew Game for that one. Both episodes were re-edited for syndication, Both episodes swapping Drew Games (327 getting Props, 334 getting Quick Change); 327 getting re-edited and censored (For the If You Know What I mean line) to make less raunchy.
What I'm pretty sure happened with CW Seed is. WB gave them the original tape to Episode 334, but was given the Re-Edited Episode 327.
and That was Whose Line History 101! XD

WRITING.TEXT: That last sentence, That's all you guys could've said! I completely agree. Always room for improvement!
Perhaps we should develop a thread here discussing what would make guests better on the show. Two Line Vocabulary is a good start, yes.

That is ENOUGH! Look, The Celebrity crap was started during Season 5, It was a damn trend, Every Season 5 taping there was had 1-2 Celebrity Guests; and if it wasn't for a High Episode count (For Season 5) and Season's 6-8 (Being totally made up from previous season tapings, except for one taping) It would have the exact same feel.
I think that maybe we should be thankful that the show's back at all! and you know what? Since Season 10 (We aren't counting Season 9 since it was pretty embarrassing) the New Seasons have actually been good. End of Discussion.

WRITING.TITLE: Which game are you looking forward to most this Season?
WRITING.TEXT:
Are there any games you guys are looking forward to most this Season? Heck, Games you're dying to see more of?
For Me:
* Show Stopping Number (Present at tapings) * Multiple Personalities (That too) * Hoedown
Just a reminder, here's our game count total for this Season. As of 6/5:
* Scenes From a Hat (5) * Living Scenery (4) * Questions (4) * Dubbing (3) * Duet (3) * Greatest Hits (3) * Helping Hands (2) * Newsflash (2) * Weird Newscasters (2) * Doo Wop (1) * Hollywood Director (1) * Let's Make A Date (1) * Old Job New Job (1) * Party Quirks (1) * Props (1) * Song Styles (1) * World's Worst (1)

WRITING.TEXT: Gee where was everyone when Season 5 came out and the special guests started being brought on? Where was the outrage then?

Seriously?! ENOUGH! Brad was in more games than the guest. If you must complain about something, and something good; Complain about the editing. Literally you have a 3 hour taping, consisting of 20-24 games; Guests taking up 3-5 games there, Then the rest of the time its different games and it involves the fourth seater, a lot (unless Colin and Ryan game or Greatest Hits on a show that involves a non singing fourth seater, but I digress). Find the editor, maybe a CW representative(?) and then send them your complaints, tell them you want more variety in the game line ups or such.
And you know, guests have been hit or miss this season; Heather was a hit in the two games she was in; (Btw be thankful cause it could've been 3-4 games. But thankfully the editor was wise to cut that down)
Yes

WRITING.TITLE: Season 11 Episode 7 - (6/5) Ratings Report
WRITING.TEXT: Last night's episode hit 1.51 in the ratings, a job well done considering it was against Jurassic Park! Look forward to Keegan next week!

Brad was in 3 out of the 5 games tonight, That's fine. You gotta understand, they do 20+ games in a 3 hour taping. Sitting out of (Most likely 3 games, if you're Brad) (4-5 out of 20 for a non-singing fourth) only a few select games isn't going to break a fourth seater. You want someone to blame, then blame the editor for not editing in the fourth seater more!

Give this guy 1000 points!

I was dreading the question. It should be "Do you prefer Clive, Drew, or Aisha?" But since we're on this question, I'm starting to prefer Aisha; Don't get me wrong I'll always have a place for Drew in my heart, as well his time as Whose Line Host. Aisha so far has brought a new dynamic, and starting Late Season 10 to the new season right now, she's really upped the energy, practically matching Drew's. She's fantastic.
Now if this were a "Do you prefer Clive, Drew, or Aisha?" question, then I might have a problem even coming up with an answer, because I love all three!
No, that was it. Oddly enough, I would like to see him on the show again in the future, perhaps as a guest fourth seater.
